biotools.summary: Crimp allows to align clusters across multiple clusterings, based on their matrices of membership coefficients (Q-matrices). This is frequently done to post-process outputs from programs like Structure (Pritchard et al. 2000). Crimp can be used as a much faster and typically more accurate alternative to CLUMPP (Jakobsson & Rosenberg 2007).
